Package com.android

Class FlowerBuilder

java.lang.Object
com.android.FlowerBuilder
class FlowerBuilder
extends Object
this is a class for building flowers, nameing convention is name of the class of Objects it is creating, in this case Flower followed by the word Builder and you end up with FlowerBuilder we have setters for each variable of the flower class we wish to give values to. each of these setters return a flowerBuilder object (which allows us to chain the methods). we then have a final builder method which returns a flower with all the variables we have set using the setter methods To see video tutorial for this section of code Video tutorial For all 177 videos, which cover all the topics in this course go to Complete Course Video Tutorial

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Flower myFlower
    when using the Builder class the first thing you need to do is to create and instance of the Object you will be creating.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    FlowerBuilder()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Flower build()
    by convention the last method in the Builder class is called build this returns the Flower that all the setter methods have given it various variable values i.e setWeight(12) would give the flower a weight of 12 setColour(Colour.RED) would give the flower a colour of Red this returns the flower that has been modified by all of the setter methods
    FlowerBuilder setAge​(int age)
    we need to create setters for each one of the Variables of the Flower class.
    FlowerBuilder setColour​(Flower.Colour colour)
    returns same FlowerBuilder objects and gives myFlower variable a colour (RED,BLUE,etc)
    FlowerBuilder setHeight​(double height)
    returns same FlowerBuilder objects and gives myFlower variable a Height
    FlowerBuilder setPetals​(int petals)
    returns same FlowerBuilder objects and gives myFlower variable a value for petals, which is the amount of petals on a flower
    FlowerBuilder setPrice​(double price)
    returns same FlowerBuilder objects and gives myFlower variable a price, which is the price charged for this flower
    FlowerBuilder setSmell​(boolean smell)
    returns same FlowerBuilder objects and gives myFlower variable a smell (true/false)
    FlowerBuilder setType​(Flower.Type type)
    each one of these setters returns the same FlowerBuilder object that is calling this method.
    FlowerBuilder setWeight​(double weight)
    returns same FlowerBuilder object and gives myFlower variable a weight

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • myFlower

      private Flower myFlower
      when using the Builder class the first thing you need to do is to create and instance of the Object you will be creating. In this case we create a Flower, that calls the blank constructor in the Flower class this produces a flower that will have default values for all of it's variables we normally make it private

  • Constructor Details

    • FlowerBuilder

      FlowerBuilder()

  • Method Details

    • setAge

      public FlowerBuilder setAge​(int age)
      we need to create setters for each one of the Variables of the Flower class. if you don't want to be able to set a value, then just dont' have a setter for it. each setter HAS TO return a Builder object, in this case, each setter has to return a FlowerBuilder Object. So each one of these methods can be chained i.e new FlowerBuilder().setAge(10).setTypes(Types.Rose).

    • setType

      public FlowerBuilder setType​(Flower.Type type)
      each one of these setters returns the same FlowerBuilder object that is calling this method. So each one of these methods can call ALL of the methods of the FlowerBuilder class setAge(10).setColour(Colour.RED) each one of these setters is giving some variable of the flower created in this class (myFlower) a value for instance setAge is giving myFlower and age other than the default of 0. returns same FlowerBuilder object and gives myFlower variable a type (rose, tulip, etc)

    • setWeight

      public FlowerBuilder setWeight​(double weight)
      returns same FlowerBuilder object and gives myFlower variable a weight

    • setHeight

      public FlowerBuilder setHeight​(double height)
      returns same FlowerBuilder objects and gives myFlower variable a Height

    • setColour

      public FlowerBuilder setColour​(Flower.Colour colour)
      returns same FlowerBuilder objects and gives myFlower variable a colour (RED,BLUE,etc)

    • setSmell

      public FlowerBuilder setSmell​(boolean smell)
      returns same FlowerBuilder objects and gives myFlower variable a smell (true/false)

    • setPetals

      public FlowerBuilder setPetals​(int petals)
      returns same FlowerBuilder objects and gives myFlower variable a value for petals, which is the amount of petals on a flower

    • setPrice

      public FlowerBuilder setPrice​(double price)
      returns same FlowerBuilder objects and gives myFlower variable a price, which is the price charged for this flower

    • build

      public Flower build()
      by convention the last method in the Builder class is called build this returns the Flower that all the setter methods have given it various variable values i.e setWeight(12) would give the flower a weight of 12 setColour(Colour.RED) would give the flower a colour of Red this returns the flower that has been modified by all of the setter methods
